text: Forest Essentials is an Indian cosmetics, skincare and perfume company that specialises in Ayurvedic preparations for its products. It was founded in 2000 by Mira Kulkarni in New Delhi, India.https://www.fortuneindia.com/people/este- lauders-dream-girl/100473 == History == Mira Kulkarni started the business in 2000 with an investment of Rs.2 lakhs, then only selling handmade soaps and candles. The business expanded after the Delhi hotel Hyatt Regency ordered the soaps for their rooms. In 2005-2006, the company posted sales of Rs.6 crore. == Business == In 2008, the New York-based Estée Lauder Companies acquired a 20% stake in the company. In 2014, this was further increased to 40%. Kulkarni's son Samrath Bedi currently serves as the managing director of the company. The company has 80 stores in India, supplies to 190 hotels and export to 120 countries. The factories are in Haridwar and Lodsi in Tehri Garhwal district, Uttarakhand. Forest Essentials sells natural, organic and Ayurvedic cosmetics and has a policy of not testing their products on animals. == References == == External links == * Category:Manufacturing companies established in 2000 Category:Personal care brands Category:Cosmetics brands Category:Cosmetics companies of India Category:Indian companies established in 2000 Category:Estée Lauder Companies Category:Luxury brands Category:Ayurvedic companies Category:Indian brands Category:Companies based in Uttarakhand
